intro: Heteropterys laurifolia var. laurifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its evergreen foliage, with lance-shaped leaves that are dark green on top and lighter green underneath. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by red, fleshy berries that are attractive to birds. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America and thrives in moist, shaded environments. This plant is often used in ornamental horticulture for its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
